question.title: Adding TextView Dynamically like in Quran
question.body:
I have an old Native Android app that was developed on Java and the app is about the Quran, so that the user could read the whole Quran from the app. So the verses is coming from the local database and each chapter is separated and the screen is updated according to the length of verses.

So I am changing the UI of the App, so that it looks closer to a book-like screen where each verse is shown after one another and if the if the verse is too long that it textview would exceed the device width, it will break the text into another line below that line and the it will add verse number 3 after that verse and so on. I will attach a quran page that so that you can get an idea what I mean and I want the textview to be added dynamically because I would be adding features to each verses after clicking that textview.

Below is the code that I have achieved till now

 TextView aayatText=new TextView(this);
        aayatText.setText(cursor.getString(1));
        aayatText.setTypeface(Typeface.createFromAsset(this.getAssets(), "fonts/New Quran.ttf"));
        aayatText.setTextSize(pref.getFontSize());
        aayatText.setTextColor(this.getResources().getColor(R.color.main_blue));
        aayatText.setTextDirection(View.TEXT_DIRECTION_RTL);
        aayatText.setGravity(Gravity.END);
        
        surah_aayat_layout.addView(aayatText);

 <HorizontalScrollView
        android:layout_width="match_parent"
        android:layout_height="wrap_content">

        <LinearLayout
            android:id="@+id/aayat_layout"
            android:layout_width="wrap_content"
            android:layout_height="wrap_content"
            android:orientation="horizontal" />
    </HorizontalScrollView>

What this code does is that it aligns every verse into one line with horizontal scrolling and I need like in the image attached.(ignore the image designing I just want the text logic to be build).
